problem_text: \overrightarrow B A and \overrightarrow B C are opposite rays and \overrightarrow B D bisects \angle A B F. If m \angle A B F = 3 x - 8 and m \angle A B D = x + 14, find m \angle A B D.
compact_text: \overrightarrow BA and \overrightarrow BC are opposite rays and \overrightarrow BD bisects \angle ABF. If m \angle ABF = 3x-8 and m \angle ABD = x+14, find m \angle ABD.
annotat_text: $\overrightarrow{BA}$ and $\overrightarrow{BC}$ are opposite rays and $\overrightarrow{BD}$ bisects $\angle ABF$. If $m \angle ABF=3x-8$ and $m \angle ABD=x+14$, find $m \angle ABD$.
